events.message: The applicant has submitted a personal loan application to cover upcoming medical expenses and consolidate existing debts.
After initial review, the application was categorized correctly under personal loans due to the applicant's stated purpose.
A loan officer with expertise in personal loans has been assigned to handle this applicant's file and guide them through the process.
The loan officer conducted the initial review of the application, ensuring that all provided information is complete and meets basic criteria.
Additional documentation was requested from the applicant, including proof of income and medical invoices to validate the loan purpose.
The applicant submitted all requested documents promptly, including medical bills, income statements, and credit history reports.
Credit check was completed showing a moderate credit score, with no recent delinquencies or defaults noted.
Risk assessment was performed based on credit data and application details, indicating manageable risk for loan approval.
An offer outlining the loan amount, interest rate, and repayment terms was presented to the applicant for review.
The applicant provided feedback on the offer, requesting a slight extension on the repayment period.
The application was escalated to the senior loan committee for consideration of the applicant’s requested changes.
The senior loan committee approved the personal loan after approving the applicant’s modified repayment terms.
The loan amount was successfully disbursed to the applicant’s designated bank account as per the funding schedule.
Follow-up was conducted to ensure the applicant has received funds and to answer any questions regarding repayment.
The loan application process was formally closed after confirming all documentation and funding was successfully completed.
